newsitem.title: USA: Saratoga to spin off part of its business.
newsitem.headline: Saratoga to spin off part of its business.

text.p: Saratoga Brands Inc said on Wednesday that its board has approved a reorganization of its business into two separate public companies through a spin-off of its mobile-catering and food-distribution business.
The mobile-catering business will be spun off to shareholders in the form of a dividend, thereby creating a new public company in a transaction that is expected to be tax-free, Saratoga said.
The company said that, through its Cucina Classics Italiana Inc subsidiary and future acquisition of Sant Ambroeus, it will remain in the cheese and restaurant business.

It will continue to qualify for and remain listed on the Nasdaq Small Cap market system, the company said, and added that the mobile-catering business is also expected to immediately qualify for Nasdaq Small Cap listing.
However, Saratoga said it has not yet been determined on which exchange or market the company will seek listing.
The company said it expects to announce further details within the next 14 days.
